de.systemagmbh.interfaces.bus
Interface ISysBus

All Superinterfaces:
ISysComponent
All Known Implementing Classes:
DummyISysBus
public interface ISysBus
extends ISysComponent

The ISysBus interface defines the Methods of the event driven Model for a Messagebus. This interface documentation covers the following issues:
Broadcast Sending Messages on Subjects. This functionality may be needed by Clients and Servers.

Request This functionality of the ISysBus is typically utilized by Client programs. The request method is quite like a function call in the view of the client. Therefore only one request should be executed at a time. Program execution halts, until either the requested data has arrived, or there was a timeout. The period to wait for a reply can be determined by the get/setTimeout() methods. If Application waittime is not wanted, the only way is to

Subscribe Receiving Messages (containing Strings) on Subjects. This functionality may be needed by Clients and Servers. There are two ways to subscribe. One of the method is heavily depending on distributed queue features.

Services: This functionality of the ISysBus is utilized by Server programs. The most complex part of Bus communication is responding to a request. All this is handled by the ISysBus and the services, registered (or added).
What methods a Service has to provide is specified by the ISysService. ISysBus knows little about Service states; it usually notifies a service has been called (activated) and returned (deactivated); It is useful to count calls and measure service execution periods. ISysBus should be able to detect, if a service has crashed and tell this the Client. But it can do little against it.

System Control Interface: A SystemControlHandler provides standard commands, that are made accessible to the Bus. This include standard services like requesting health status, getting help on the available services etc. Some SystemControl commands may involve complex tasks for the application like shut down all Services. This cannot be done by the ISysBus, since shutdown Service may include commiting of database operations, closing files etc.

Version:
$Revision: 1.12 $
Author:
Herbert Helmstreit

Method Detail

init

public void init(ISysConfigItem configItem)
          throws CSysBusException,
                 CSysConfigException
Usually only called by factory.

Throws:
CSysBusException
CSysConfigException

addService

public void addService(ISysService service)
                throws CSysBusException
Adds a new Service. Services are referenced by their name returned by ISysComponent.getComponentName(). Thus the same service should not be added twice. After adding the service it is activated at once; Therefore it should be able to handle requests, before it is added to the ISysBus.

Parameters:
service - The Service to add.
Throws:
CSysBusException - is thrown.
See Also:
ISysService

removeService

public void removeService(String name)
                   throws CSysBusException
Removes a previously added Service. If the service is in the running state (activated) ISysBus must wait, until the service has finalized. Note: This may be problematic in the development phase, if services are likely to "hang".

Parameters:
name - The name of the Service to remove. Must be same as returned by ISysComponent.getComponentName();
Throws:
CSysBusException - is thrown.

removeAllServices

public void removeAllServices()
Removes all previously added Services. This method usually is called by the ISysBus, when finalizing. It is seldom needed on other occasions.

getServiceStatus

public ISysMessage getServiceStatus()
Returns status information of all previously added services.

Returns:
status information of all previously added services, as ISysMessage

getServiceNames

public String[] getServiceNames()
Returns the names of all previously added services.

Returns:
the names of all previously added services as a String array;

finalize

public void finalize()
              throws Throwable
Clean up the ISysBus by terminating everything.

Throws:
Throwable - may be thrown.

addSystemControl

public void addSystemControl(ISysService service)
                      throws CSysBusException
Pass control to SystemControl; This is similar to addService, but:
  • SystemControl commands never get into a distributed queue service
  • If you are running distributed queue server, SystemControl commands bind to a different message queue.
  • Some SystemControl commands (like "exit") require special care concerning request/reply

Parameters:
service - The Service class that wants to handle a SystemControl command
Throws:
CSysBusException

publish

public void publish(ISysSubject subject,
                    ISysMessage msg)
             throws CSysBusException
General mechanism to publish a MessageObject. User has to provide the correct ISysSubject.

Parameters:
subject - The ISysSubject, for wich the Data is for.
msg - The message to publish, implementations must accept ISysMessage
Throws:
CSysBusException - if the data object type is not supported.

addBusEventListener

public void addBusEventListener(ISysSubject subject,
                                ISysBusEventListener listener)
                         throws CSysBusException
Subscribes to Messages specified by ISysSubject. Any Message on that Subject gets delivered to the listener, as far as the Messageformat is correct. This is also the case for Applications running in a distributed queue. Every member of the Queue gets the message. See addUniqueBusEventListener(), if you want only one out of N group members to receive the message.

Please make sure, your program removes all added BusEventListener; otherwise evil things are very likely to happen. E.g. unwanted references to eventhandlers, not deleted by the Garbage collector. This may eat up system resources and even stop program execution. A ISysBusEventListener should only be used for one ISysSubject, do not add the same twice. If you want multible subscriptions, use Wildcards (if the Implementation suports this) or multible ISysBusEventListener.

Parameters:
subject - The ISysSubject to subscribe to
listener - A ISysBusEventListener provided and implemented by application.
Throws:
CSysBusException - if the Listener could not be added.
See Also:
how to remove a Listener.

addUniqueBusEventListener

public void addUniqueBusEventListener(ISysSubject subject,
                                      ISysBusEventListener listener)
                               throws CSysBusException
Applications running in a distributed queue may want to use this method to subscribe. ISysBus must have been configured to support this mode of operation. Only one member of the Queue will get the message. Use the method addBusEventListener(), if you want all members of the group to receive the message, not one out of the queue or your program is not running in a distributed queue anyway.

Parameters:
subject - The ISysSubject to subscribe to
listener - A BusEventListener provided and implemented by application.
Throws:
CSysBusException - if the Listener could not be added. This will always be the case, if ISysBus was not be configured to distributed queue operations.
See Also:
removeBusEventListener(de.systemagmbh.interfaces.bus.ISysBusEventListener)

removeBusEventListener

public void removeBusEventListener(ISysBusEventListener listener)
Remove (a previously added) BusEventListener

Parameters:
listener - the previously added BusEventListener to remove
See Also:
addBusEventListener(de.systemagmbh.interfaces.bus.ISysSubject, de.systemagmbh.interfaces.bus.ISysBusEventListener)

request

public ISysMessage request(ISysSubject subject,
                           ISysMessage msg)
                    throws CSysBusException,
                           CSysMessageException
Send a Request, using the currend timeout setting and wait for reply.

Parameters:
subject - The service ISysSubject
msg - The data to send with this message implementations must accept ISysMessage
If there is a ISysService adressed, the String reprentation of data are exactly the parameter arguments needed by the run() method of the remote Service.
Returns:
the reply comming via the Bus as a ISysMessage
Throws:
CSysBusException - if a Reply does not arrive within the timeout periode
CSysMessageException - if sent or passed message format is not correct.
See Also:
setTimeout(long), getTimeout()

request

public ISysMessage request(ISysSubject subject,
                           ISysMessage msg,
                           long timeout)
                    throws CSysBusException,
                           CSysMessageException
Send a Request, defining a local timeout and wait for reply.

Parameters:
subject - The service ISysSubject
msg - The data to send with this message implementations must accept ISysMessage
If there is a ISysService adressed, the String reprentation of data are exactly the parameter arguments needed by the run() method of the remote Service.
timeout - The time in milliseconds this function waits.
Returns:
the reply comming via the Bus as a ISysMessage
Throws:
CSysBusException - if a Reply does not arrive within the timeout periode
CSysMessageException - if sent or passed message format is not correct.

dispatch

public void dispatch()
              throws InterruptedException
Get some time to work, especially to dispatch messages; This must be called by the main program, if externaldispatch option was selected, whenever there is time to receive new Messages. Using this technique, you will receive Messages synchronously. If externaldispatch option was not selected, you will receive Messages asynchronously.

Throws:
InterruptedException
